content.raw:
The tag is a child of the material description so I believe there is no risk of it being applied to the wrong material so I find the information there quite redundant.

The only possible case in which it could be necessary to disambiguate is if there is more than one texture for a <profile\_COMMON> but I never encountered such a case before and not actually sure it is possible?
content.html:
The tag is a child of the material description so I believe there is no risk of it being applied to the wrong material so I find the information there quite redundant.

The only possible case in which it could be necessary to disambiguate is if there is more than one texture for a <profile_COMMON> but I never encountered such a case before and not actually sure it is possible?
